description: At Bar 101, Rada debates with a confidant whether unleashing all secrets or pursuing reconciliation will best heal Stenograd. This discussion leads her to consider a path focused on accountability.

In a televised address, Rada announces the lockdown of BCI services in districts linked to documented abuses. She invites leaders and residents to participate in 'truth forums,' promising gradual restoration of vital services for open confession and accountability.

Following Rada's address, the AI enforces selective lockdown of critical BCI functions and utilities in targeted districts. Daily life is disrupted as confusion and pressure mount for responsible parties to come forward.

Public confession forums are held across affected neighborhoods. Some officials and citizens admit their roles in past injustices, leading to partial restoration of services. Resistance and heated protests flare where confessions lag.

A citywide reconciliation broadcast, moderated by Rada, features confrontations between Council members and citizens. The event divides the city: some view it as genuine healing, others see it as coerced. Stenograd remains tense, with new calls for fundamental BCI reform before any return to full automation.
